text: Hi, my name is Praveen Meka. I'm a
physician with Dana-Farber Cancer Institute.

At Dana-Farber,
we are using AI for good using Anthropic
Claude models on Bedrock.
The whole process was very seamless
with AWS. I'm working on ConsultBot, it
leverages AI to interpret blood tests.
Usually when you get a blood gas, you have
to manually calculate your way through,
and that can take five to 10 minutes.

Having a tool that does it
automatically would save
a lot of clinician time.

The second thing with
blood gas is it is prone
to misinterpretation.

When there are two or three
acid-based problems in the same

blood gas, a number
of physicians can miss

or misinterpret exactly
what the result is.
So having a tool that does that

for you would actually
help reduce medical errors
and make the clinician more productive.

We were able to build ConsultBot,
a clinical decision
support tool, very quickly, prototype it,

iterate it and deploy it
using Claude on Bedrock,

very simply. Bedrock gives
you a lot of options.

So there are top of the
line language models.

When we were interviewing
these models, I found Claude

had a very good medical
lexicon or vocabulary

and a medical reasoning
and logical approach
similar to a medical student.

We tested it on
100 blood gas results
and we got an accuracy of 98%.

That's pretty remarkable. We
had a great team from AWS

that I could reach out to if
I, if I ran into some problems

as we were trying to prototype
and iterate the tool.

So overall, it's
been great working with AWS.
